title: Chocolate chip cookies
ingredients: Optional: 1 cup chopped nuts (e.g., walnuts or pecans)
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium bowl combine
2 ¼ cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
and 1 teaspoon salt.
Set this mixture aside.
In a large mixing bowl
beat 1 cup of softened butter
¾ cup granulated sugar
¾ cup brown sugar
and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until the mixture is creamy and well-blended.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, mixing slowly until fully combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips (and nuts, if desired) using a spatula or spoon.
Drop rounded tablespoons of cookie dough onto an ungreased baking sheet
leaving about 2 inches between each cookie to allow for spreading.
Bake: Bake the cookies for 9-11 minutes or until they are golden brown around the edges.
Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Fried rice
ingredients: 1 to 1 ½ cups of diced vegetables
2 to 3 stalks of chopped green onions
instructions: Ensure the rice is cold and separated.
If using protein, cook it separately and set aside.
Scramble the eggs in a hot pan with a little oil, then set them aside.
Sauté garlic, onions, and vegetables in oil until tender.
Add the cold rice and stir-fry it with the veggies.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce (optional), and other seasonings.
Stir until evenly coated.
Mix in the cooked protein and scrambled eggs.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

title: Greek salad
ingredients: ½ medium thinly sliced red onions
3-4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
instructions: Chop the tomatoes, cucumbers, and bell pepper, and slice the onions thinly
In a large bowl, combine the chopped vegetables, olives, and feta cheese.
Drizzle olive oil, red wine vinegar (or lemon juice)
Sprinkle dried oregano, salt, and pepper over the salad
Gently toss the salad to mix the ingredients without breaking up the feta too much.
